definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) Impudence or brazenness ; temerity ; chutzpah .

( physiology , archaic , uncountable ) Bile , especially that of an animal ; the greenish , profoundly bitter - tasting fluid found in bile ducts and gall bladders , structures associated with the liver .
( figurative , uncountable ) Great misery or physical suffering , likened to the bitterest - tasting of substances.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Impudence or brazenness ; temerity ; chutzpah .
secondary_definitions: ( physiology , archaic , uncountable ) Bile , especially that of an animal ; the greenish , profoundly bitter - tasting fluid found in bile ducts and gall bladders , structures associated with the liver .
( figurative , uncountable ) Great misery or physical suffering , likened to the bitterest - tasting of substances.

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A sore on a horse caused by an ill- fitted or ill- adjusted saddle ; a saddle sore .
( pathology , countable ) A sore or open wound caused by chafing , which may become infected, as with a blister .
( figurative , uncountable ) A feeling of exasperation .
( countable , technical ) A pit on a surface being cut caused by the friction between the two surfaces exceeding the bond of the material at a point.

main_definition: ( countable ) A sore on a horse caused by an ill- fitted or ill- adjusted saddle ; a saddle sore .
secondary_definitions: ( pathology , countable ) A sore or open wound caused by chafing , which may become infected, as with a blister .
( figurative , uncountable ) A feeling of exasperation .
( countable , technical ) A pit on a surface being cut caused by the friction between the two surfaces exceeding the bond of the material at a point.

definitions.definition: A blister or tumor -like growth found on the surface of plants, caused by various pathogens , especially the burrowing of insect larvae into the living tissues, such as that of the common oak gall wasp ( Cynips quercusfolii ).
A bump -like imperfection resembling a gall.

main_definition: ( phytopathology ) A blister or tumor -like growth found on the surface of plants, caused by various pathogens , especially the burrowing of insect larvae into the living tissues, such as that of the common oak gall wasp ( Cynips quercusfolii ).
secondary_definitions: A bump -like imperfection resembling a gall.
